Package playground

Class SpaceInvadersLevel

  • java.lang.Object
    • playground.Playground
      • playground.SpaceInvadersLevel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BossLevel, ExperimentierLevel6, HitTwiceLevel, Level1, Level2, Level3, Level4
    public class SpaceInvadersLevel
extends Playground
    Class that realizes all the game logic of a SpaceInvaders-type level. This is the class that you inerit from if you want to create your own SpaceInvaders-tpe levels. Functions performed by this class are:
    • initially set up the level, spawn all object etc., in method prepareLevel(java.lang.String)
    • define a game state machine, replay initial message and detect collisions in method prepareLevel(java.lang.String)
    • create a lot of utility functions to redefine if you want to change a certain aspect of the level

      • prepareLevel

        public void prepareLevel​(java.lang.String id)
        initially sets up the level. Not called by user, but called every time a layer is restarted from scratch. So make sure that this is possible. Here, resources are loaded only once even if method is called several times.
        Specified by:
        prepareLevel in class Playground
        Parameters:
        id - String identifies level.

      • redrawLevel

        public void redrawLevel​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        (re)draws the level but NOT the objects, they draw themselves. Called by the main game loop. This method mainly draws the background and the scoreboard.
        Specified by:
        redrawLevel in class Playground
        Parameters:
        g2 - Graphics2D object that can, and should be, draw on.

      • applyGameLogic

        public void applyGameLogic()
        applies the logic of the level: For now, this is just about deleting shots that are leaving the screen
        Specified by:
        applyGameLogic in class Playground
